abstract: Justice Barbara Jaffe of New York State Supreme Court rules that chimpanzees Hercules and Leo, research subjects at State University of New York at Stony Brook, are legally considered property and not afforded rights of human beings.
lead_paragraph: The Nonhuman Rights Project had sought to free a pair of research animals from a university on Long Island, in the group’s latest attempt to establish apes as “legal persons."

headline.main: New York Judge Denies Request to Extend Legal Rights to 2 Chimps
headline.print_headline: Legal Rights of 2 Chimps Are Limited, Judge Says

snippet: The Nonhuman Rights Project had sought to free a pair of research animals from a university on Long Island, in the group’s latest attempt to establish apes as “legal persons."

keywords.value: State University of New York at Stony Brook
